message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: private void writeString(DataOutputStream dataOutputStream, String string) throws IOException {
    byte[] bytes = string.getBytes("UTF-8");
    dataOutputStream.write(bytes, 0, bytes.length);
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue you are facing is due to the limitation of the TelnetClient's DataOutputStream. The write method you are using has a limitation of 1955 characters. To overcome this limitation, you can use the write method from the DataOutputStream class directly. The provided code snippet demonstrates how to write a string longer than 1955 characters using the DataOutputStream.write method.
